body.name: CORSAIR RM Series (2021), White, RM850, 850 Watt, 80 Plus Gold Certified, Fully Modular Power Supply
body.merchantInfo: Ships from and sold by InfinityProduct.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 2 hrs 7 mins
features: Fully modular, so you only connect the cables your system needs.
Triple EPS12V connectors for full compatibility with modern graphics cards and motherboards.
A 140mm rifle bearing fan with a specially calculated fan curve ensures that fan noise is kept to a minimum, even at full load.
Zero RPM fan mode for near-silent operation at low to medium loads.
Industrial-grade, 105°C-rated capacitors deliver solid electrical performance and reliability.
body.description: CORSAIR RM Series Fully Modular Ultra-Low Noise Power Supplies deliver consistent 80 PLUS Gold efficient power to your PC. With triple/dual EPS12V cables and four PCIe 8-pin power connectors, RM PSUs have all the connections needed to power today’s most demanding PC upgrades. Industrial-grade, 105°C-rated capacitors deliver superb electrical performance and reliability, backed by a ten-year warranty.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.8 4.8 out of 5 stars 1,558 ratings 4.8 out of 5 stars

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: GOLD-CERTIFIED QUIET POWER CORSAIR RM Series Fully Modular Ultra-Low Noise Power Supplies with multiple EPS12V connectors deliver consistent 80 PLUS Gold efficient power to your PC and have all the connections needed to power today’s most demanding PC upgrades.
AVAILABLE IN BLACK OR WHITE Going for a stealthy look or modern minimalism? RM Series PSUs are available in black or white variants to fit your build style.
TUNED FOR LOW NOISE OPERATION A 140mm rifle bearing fan with a specially calculated fan curve ensures that fan noise is kept to a minimum, even at full load.
HIGH EFFICIENCY With upwards of 90% peak efficiency, RM produces less noise and less heat, which means less time worrying and more time gaming.

FULLY MODULAR WITH MULTIPLE EPS12V CONNECTORS Completely modular cables means you only connect the cables your system needs, and the wide range of included cables adds broad compatibility with modern graphics cards and motherboards. Also compatible with the CORSAIR 12-pin GPU power cable for the hottest new GPUs.

ZERO RPM FAN MODE At low and medium loads the cooling fan switches off entirely for near-silent operation. Once the action picks up, the fan activates, ensuring critical component temps stay in check.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Corsair Stands By Their Products!
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this PSU for my wife's ITX build (white). The unit is completely modular, extremely well-built and completely silent. The white finish matches the ThermalTake ITX case I bought, and all of the cables are wrapped individually in a white mesh sleeve with the connectors in black. It looks like a Star Wars Storm Trooper (that's good in my opinion). There were more than enough cables for my ITX build and had I used an ATX case, I would have had plenty to connect all of the components.I've used Corsair products in various PC builds for years and that is for a reason. I had a unit of RAM go bad after 4 years of use and Corsair replaced all units at no cost to me even though the other 3 units had no errors. Corsair stands by their products, they are built to perform, and when the inevitable happens they are there to help you.Don't buy cheap power supplies! Research PC components and get opinions from people who actually build PCs (YouTube: Gamer's Nexus, Jayz 2 Cents, Linus Tech Tips, Hardware Canucks, etc) and see what they have to say--you'll be glad you invested the time before you buy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This power supply does its job, does it well, and looks really good.I’ve got it in a Fractal Pop Air XL and they look like they are made for eachother, the patterns are the same on them and you’d think they would sell the things together because of how perfectly they compliment eachother.Only issue is I had to install my power supply upside down to get optimal usage heat output (didn’t want my power supply blowing up into my case) but luckily the product emblem is just a sticker on the portion you can see so I can easily remove it if I decide to be nitpicky about it.Came with plenty of cables that also look really good in my build, very high quality and you’ll probably only top them if you opt for custom cables. I just reached the end of the cable length capability in my install but I was also building in a full tower XL case so… that’ll happen. If you’re doing a large build you may need some custom longer cords if you are concerned about bending/the aesthetics of it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Power Supply has worked well since installing. It is very quiet as well. Just what I was looking for

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful, Powerful, Reliable
reviews.reviewText: Came recommended in a few lists talking about long-lasting quality power supplies. It's absolutely gorgeous and fit well with my build.When it comes to saving money, the power supply is NOT the part you want to cheap out on. Sure you can say stuff like the motherboard or the CPU is the heart of the computer, but a bad power supply can kill it all. I'm not too knowledgeable when it comes to the specifics of a PSU, but PSU Cultist is a well-known and trusted reviewer and the tier-list has been trusted by many and I can definitely support them. I've had this PSU with my build for about 2 years now and it's going strong.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars it’s perfect for my build
reviews.reviewText: fits nice and cozy in my airflow 4000. only issue i had was my hard drive being in the way, but luckily i have an ssd. i just removed the hard drive tray and was left with tons of room for my cords to be tucked away without worrying about damaging the cords

reviews.reviewText: It’s Corsair! Works exactly as you would expect!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great Modular Power Supply, But CPU Cable May Not Be Compatible With Motherboard
reviews.reviewText: The Corsair power supply does a good job for my custom build. Its modular plug design means you only install the cables you need which greatly simplifies cable management. However, for my MSI B450M PRO-VDH MAX motherboard the Corsair 8-pin CPU cable has the wrong pin configuration. Corsair support initially denied the issue, then later confirmed that they did not and could not provide the required CPU power cable for my MOBO. So, I purchased a YEZriler CPU Power Adapter Sleeved Cable through Amazon that plugs into both the Corsair power supply and the MSI MOBO.

I have this running my i7 13700k with Nvidia RTX 3060 and it is working well. I haven't noticed any problems so far.It wasn't super important to me, but I like that it matches my white case well. The price was right, so the color was a bonus.The modular cables allows me to only install the ones I need without having a bunch of extras all over the place.
Todo excelente, durará muchos años y es bonita, tiene muchos cables y es fácil de acomodar.

I didn't expect this to come with white cables but it did! Makes my all-white PC looks great, and has sufficient power for a 3090. Note that you'll probably need to get an extra PCIe cable if you have a GPU with 3 pins though, and PSU cables are NOT universal so you'll need to make sure they're designed for the RM.

la verdad es que es una muy buena fuente de poder por el precio, no he tenido ningún problema, no es ruidosa ademas de que me permite actualizar a una mejor tarjeta grafica o targeta madre sin ningun problema
Hay páginas para calcular el consumo de watts de los componentes de la PCNo consumo ni el 50%Pero así lo voy a dejar por si hay que dar una mejora a los componentes
